page.title: 16Cressing Temple
page.content: Cressing Temple Farm is in the very northeast of our area and on the main road between Braintree and Witham. It has 666 acres and is up for sale at the moment for{Â£2,000,000.}At one time it included about one thousand acres. The history of the farm goes back a very long way to the days of the Knight Templars who were given land by the king to provide them with money to help to get to the Holy Land and Jerusalem. The land they were given was known as a manor and others in Essex were at Little Maplestead and near Tilbury. The land grew crops and these were stored in two very large barns which are still in use today and are known as the Wheat Barn and the Barley Barn. They also had the right to tithes (which means tenths) from a wider area.
